heisig_chinese_memo: Wow, that baker must really be mad! He's trying to ruin his mortar by throwing it to the soil. Whoa! Now he's aiming a missile at it!
heisig_constituent: break, mortar, soil, dirt, ground, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch
Keyword_KANJIDIC: break, destroy, censure, be chipped, be scratched, be broken, be ruined
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: сломать, уничтожить, порицание, быть сколы, поцарапать, сломать, быть разрушен
koohiiStory1: To "break the soil" is to make a symbolic gesture that indicates the beginning of construction. Like when a politician in a hardhat gets a shovel and lifts a piece of dirt. This particular project is behind schedule, so to speed things up, they blow it up with mortar and an air-to-ground missile.
koohiiStory2: Place your mortar on solid ground before firing missiles from it, otherwise it will break.
kunYomi: こぼ.つ、こわ.す、こぼ.れる、こわ.れる、そし.る、やぶ.る
Ru_Meaning: break, destroy, censure, be chipped, be scratched, be broken, be ruined
Ru_Radicals: 几 (стол), 又 (опять), 土 (земля), 殳 (удар), 臼 (ступа)
Ru_trainchinese: huǐ: (глаг) разрушать, уничтожать; сжигать; клеветать, наговаривать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a mortar (臼) on the earth (土) is as good as a lance shaft (殳) for destroying
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To ruin a house you can be boring and use a wrecking ball like a missile, or you can attach some mortar and i-beams to the end of a crane and smash the house with that!
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions change from "殳" from "儿", the lower part of "儿" with " earth " shape to " 𡈼 ", "殳" elephant holds a hammering weapon. The word will hit the son with a weapon, the original meaning is to destroy. "Little Erya. Guangyan: "Destroy, destroy."

The words of Ejun’s Qiche Festival in Jinwen start from " 𡈼 ", which is the same as the ancient texts on bamboo slips of the Warring States Period and "Shuowen". "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. The writing of " destroy " on the back of Jian 138 of the Japanese Book A Type is from "殳" from " Jiu " from "土", which has the same shape as Xiaozhuan.

The inscription " destroy " has the meaning of subtraction, E Jun Qi Che Festival: "Women (such as) horses, women (such as) cows, women (such as) De (犆), Tunshitai (Yi) Tang (Dang) One Car, female (such as) Tantu, Tunniandantai (Yi) Tang (dang) a car, Taiwan (Yi) was destroyed in the fifty rides." The full sentence means horses, cows, oxen and other goods carried in bulk , Ten pieces together can be regarded as a wagon; twenty pieces of goods borne by manpower can be regarded as one wagon together, and the number of horses, cows, oxen, and bachelors is proportionally subtracted from 50 goods (Guo Moruo ). The handed down documents also use " destroy " to indicate deduction, such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Thirty Years of Zhuang Gong": "Self-destroy his family to alleviate the difficulties of Chu." Du's note: "Destroy, reduce." The whole sentence refers to the loss of family wealth to alleviate the crisis of Chu. "Said Wen": "Destroy, lack of it. From the soil, the sound of the province. 𣪷, the ancient text is destroyed from 𡈼." Its meaning is similar to that used in the E-Jun Qi Car Festival.

The " destroy " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is used as the original meaning, referring to destruction, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu IV. "Cao Mozhichen" Jane 10: "Destroy the bell shape and saint (listen) the state government." The full sentence refers to the order that people destroy the mold used to make the bell and deal with the state government affairs.

Qin Jian in the " destruction " may pass as though " Hui ", "Shuihudi Jane. "Cang Lv" brief: "[Su Yi] six buckets of stone are mostly half buckets, and the pound is yi (粝) rice and one stone; xi rice and one stone are chisel (糳) meters and nine buckets; nine [dou] is destroying (毇) meters and eight buckets "Shuowen": "Yi, Mi Yihu is a Badouye." The description is consistent with the simplified text.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions change from "殳" from "儿", the lower part of "儿" with " earth " shaped to become " 𡈼 ", "殳" elephant holds a hammering weapon. The word will hit the son with a weapon, the original meaning is to destroy.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「殳」從「兒」，「兒」的下部加「土」形訛變為「𡈼」，「殳」象手持捶撃武器。字會以武器敲打兒子之意，本義是毀壞。《小爾雅．廣言》：「毀，壞也。」

　　金文鄂君啟車節字從「𡈼」，與戰國竹簡、《說文》古文同。《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡138背「毀」寫作從「殳」從「臼」從「土」，與小篆字形相同。

　　金文「毀」有減去之義，鄂君啟車節：「女(如)馬，女(如)牛，女(如)德(犆)，屯十台(以)堂(當)一車，女(如)擔徒，屯廿擔台(以)堂(當)一車，台(以)毀於五十乘之中。」全句意思是馬、牛、犆等馱運的貨物，十件加起來可當成一車；人力擔負的貨物，二十件加起來可當成一車，把那些馬、牛、犆、擔徒之數按比例從五十輛貨物之中減去(郭沫若)。傳世文獻亦有用「毀」來表示扣去，如《左傳．莊公三十年》：「自毀其家以紓楚國之難。」杜預注：「毀，減也。」全句指自己減損家財，以緩和楚國的危難。《說文》：「毀，缺也。从土，毇省聲。𣪷，古文毀从𡈼。」其義與鄂君啟車節所用相近。

　　戰國竹簡「毀」用作本義，指毀壞，《上博楚竹書四．曹沫之陳》簡10：「乃命毀鐘型而聖(聽)邦政。」全句指於是命令人把鑄鐘用的模子毀掉，而處理國家政務。

　　秦簡中「毀」可通假作「毇」，《睡虎地秦簡．倉律》簡：「[粟一]石六斗大半斗，舂之為䊪(糲)米一石；䊪米一石為鑿(糳)米九斗；九[斗]為毀(毇)米八斗。」《說文》：「毇，米一斛舂為八斗也。」所述與簡文相合。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「殳」從「兒」，「兒」的下部加「土」形訛變為「𡈼」，「殳」象手持捶撃武器。字會以武器敲打兒子之意，本義是毀壞。

②燒掉：燒燬。焚燬。
③把成件的舊東西改造成別的東西：一張舊桌子毀成兩個小凳子。
④誹謗，說別人的壞話：毀謗。譭譽。詆譭。

毀字的基本解释

毀
huǐ
古同“毁”。

毀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huì］
同“毁1”。
“毁”的日本用汉字。

毀字的康熙字典解释

【辰集下】【殳字部】　毀； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页586第12
〔古文〕?【唐韻】許委切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】虎委切，?音燬。【說文】缺也。一曰壞也。【易·繫辭】乾坤毀，則無以見易。【詩·豳風】無毀我室。　又訾也。【論語】誰毀誰譽。　又去也。【禮·儒行】毀方而瓦合。【鄭註】去已之大圭角，下與小人合也。　又折也。【戰國策】王不搆趙。趙不以毀搆。【註】搆，合其戰也。毀，折也。不收趙，趙不能以毀折之兵獨與秦戰。　又占歲法，金穰，水毀，木飢，火旱。見【史記·貨殖傳】。　又禱祈除殃曰毀。【周禮·地官·牧人】凡外祭毀事用尨。【註】謂副辜?禳毀除殃咎之屬。　又哀毀。【禮·曲禮】居喪之禮，毀瘠不形。【正義】毀瘠，羸瘠也，形骨露也。居喪許羸瘦，不許骨露見也。又五十不致毀，六十不毀。【孝經·喪親章】毀不滅性。　又小兒去齒曰毀。【白虎通】男八歲毀齒，女七歲毀齒。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?况僞切，音齂。義同。　又叶後五切，音戸。【易林】臏詐龎子，夷竈盡毀。兵休卒發，矢至如雨。　又叶暄規切，音墮。【揚子·太?經】減其疾不至危也，

毀字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
毀字的起名意思

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Jixia] [Department of 殳字] 　 Rui; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 586 No. 12
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Xu Weiqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Tiger Weiqie, sound destroyed. [Said the text] also lacking. One said it was bad. 【Easy · Ci】The world is ruined, and there is no easy way to see it. 【Poetry·Binfeng】No damage to my room.　 You Zi Ye. [The Analects] Who destroys the reputation.　Go again. 【Rite·Confucianism】Destroy squares and tiles together. [Zheng's Note] Go to Daguijiao, and get together with the villain.　It's also folded again. [Warring States Policy] Wang does not construct Zhao. Zhao does not destroy the structure. [Note] The structure is the same as the battle. Destroy, fold it.
